Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The main thing required for heavy counts is a very very fast internet connection... Like insane fast, most vps providers are good enough, but a home connection or a small data centre like where my sever is, can have very low counts... Especially because we are not enforcing regions, there will likely end up a small group of nodes who are all very close together that will dominate counts... I've said this would be an issue fro. the start, and alright just said to move node to where it preforms better... I guess we all end up in the same data centre that way, u leas we split the group in half and use 2 dcs lol...

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: @Alright - it seems that high pos difficulty gives high pow difficulty, at least that is how I have read past posts in here about needing a mini to counter high pos and re-balance?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes ... kind of

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
How it works... is something like this, (this is my understanding anyway)
PoS ... it calculates if it can win, if it cant then it does not try... as time passes, the calculation becomes easier, until a utxo can stake and tries.
PoW ... is PoW BUT ... if the PoS % is too low the PoW difficulty  increases exponentially really really fast until the PoW cannot find a block.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This means without enough hash rate, the PoS can just over take the PoW because it gets an easier difficulty after 384s passes since the last block, PoS will always find a block, has upsides nad down sides, upside is chain can never stall, and hash attacks dont happen.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Down side is blocks can be a little inconsitant ... although not as bad as BTC is. üòÉ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I am really looking foward to the main chain, to see what happens with a high hash rate and a long enough time period, if the inconsitent blocks stop happening.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: diff is purely based on blocktimes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the PoW needs to solve a recalculated diff based on whether recent percentage if above or below the target

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the PoW diff adjustment is very steep. it needs to handle ASIC arriving and disappearing

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The issue we see, is at very low hash rates (CPU mining) the actual base diff is too high for them to find blocks.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Really dont think its a problem, as a single GPU is usally enough to fix it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or many CPUs
